text: Roentgenium (, ) is a chemical element. It is a transition metal. Its symbol is Rg, and its atomic number is 111. The element is named in honor of a German physicist Wilhelm RÃ¶ntgen. So far, it has not been found in nature. There seem to be 7 isotopes. All of them are radioactive. They have a half life of between 1.6 milliseconds and 26 seconds. Because of the Inert pair effect, it could have a color similar to that of gold. Category:Transition metals Category:Synthetic elements
title: Roentgenium
